sentences.english: Woman gives two centavos to some little beggar boy.
sentences.chinese: 女人給街邊小乞丐兩分錢。

sentences.english: The poor pauper paused on purpose to pawn a porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 貧窮的乞丐有意停下來典當一隻海豚。

sentences.english: People who go begging for money or food are called beggars .
sentences.chinese: 那些乞討錢或食物的人稱作爲乞丐。

sentences.english: Sure he is. He is a famous bagger.
sentences.chinese: 當然啦，他是一個著名的乞丐。

sentences.english: The beggar was dressed in rags.
sentences.chinese: 這個“乞丐”穿着破衣爛衫。

sentences.english: The mendacious beggar told a different tale of woe at every house.
sentences.chinese: 那個好說謊的乞丐在每家說不同的悲哀故事。

sentences.english: I saw a beggar wolf down a piece of bread in the street yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我看見一個乞丐在街上狼吞虎嚥地喫一塊麪包。

sentences.english: Let us not give too generously to beggars either.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們不要給予乞丐太多的慷慨。

sentences.english: One can no longer walk the streets without seeing beggars importuning passers by.
sentences.chinese: 走在街上總能看到乞丐糾纏行人乞討。

sentences.english: Ann: Honestly, there are so many beggars who are pretended to cheat the passerby.
sentences.chinese: 老實說，很多乞丐都是假裝的，以此來騙路人的錢。

sentences.english: From this it was but a step to beggary .
sentences.chinese: 這隻差一步就淪爲乞丐了。

sentences.english: Some beggars sponge money from passengers in the railway station.
sentences.chinese: 一些乞丐向車站裏的旅客討錢。

sentences.english: The beggar's limp was a fake.
sentences.chinese: 那乞丐的跛足乃系作僞。

sentences.english: With his head stuck on the ground, the poor man acknowledged her kindness and beckoned the woman to go away.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐善解人意地趴在地上擺了擺手，示意女人離開。

sentences.english: If wihers were horses, beggars weselves ride.
sentences.chinese: 如果願望是馬，乞丐也有馬騎。

sentences.english: He impecunious is demoralized, be reduced to poverty does beggar to street.
sentences.chinese: 身無分文的他意志消沉，淪落到街頭做乞丐。

definition: variant of 叫花子[jiao4 hua1 zi5]
to go begging/to ask for alms
